meanings.sent1: The volcano began to spew hot lava down its slopes.
meanings.sent2: The broken pipe spewed water all over the floor.
meanings.sent3: The malfunctioning machine decided to spew out confetti instead of paper.
meanings.sent4: The angry dragon spewed fire from its mouth, scaring everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing garbage can spewed a foul odor into the room.

meanings.sent1: After eating too much, he felt sick and had to spew in the bathroom.
meanings.sent2: The cat spewed a hairball onto the carpet.
meanings.sent3: The baby decided to spew peas all over the high chair, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: The motion sickness made her spew her breakfast on the boat.
meanings.sent5: The food poisoning caused him to spew uncontrollably, leading to a trip to the hospital.

meanings.definition: To emit or release in large quantities
meanings.sent1: The factory spewed smoke into the sky, polluting the air.
meanings.sent2: The car spewed exhaust fumes as it accelerated.
meanings.sent3: The overflowing river spewed water over the banks, causing a flood.
meanings.sent4: The burst dam spewed water downstream, causing chaos in the village.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds spewed rain over the parched land, bringing relief to the farmers.
